div.p: Frederick Bailey to Alphonse de Candolle
Letter press copy book 2, p. 642, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

The VIII vol. of Monographiae Phanerog[...] just to hand. I find is devoted to a monograph of the Order Guttiferae. Monographs of this kind, we, in the colonies hail with the greatest pleasure and I consider that to be of real use must be prepared by the European botanists. At the smae time you will I feel sure agree with me that in the present case care has not been taken to have alldescribed species of the genus Garcinia included. For instance I was the first to describe an Australian species, G. Mestoni, int he report of the Bellenden Ker Expedition published in 1889 and in my third Supplement of [...] of the Queensland Flora in 1890. yet htis is passed over and one described by Baron Mueller of Melbourne G. Warrenii, in 1891 is duly recorded. This mishapmight be looked over had I been some obscure botanist whose writings were difficult to obtain. But as botanist to one of the most important of the australian colonies I consider it unpardonable. By this mail I post the third Suppl [...] that you may have the description of the Bellenden Ker plant & my Botany Bulletin No IV in which I have noticed Baron Mueller's species — you will see fromt he note I attached to it, that I had an idea that from no reference in Baron Mueller's description being made to these having been found a Garcinia in Queensland previous to G. Warrenii, that his would considered to be the first — this is of little moment either here or in England where we are both known, but I feel gretly hurt at the slight [...] upon my work in your monograph for works like these we trust to
